text:
Huge fan of SiteGround, we also use WPEngine, which has some nice features but we’re finding the price and support doesn’t really match up with our expectations.

SiteGround I’ve found has impressive support, competitive pricing, and great tools like staging and a git interface thing.

I would strongly recommend against GoDaddy(unintelligent  non-personal support, we’ve had to fix more hacked sites on GoDaddy than all other host’s we’ve used combined.)
Dream Host is really good too. I have been using them for around 7 years

Yea i would never go with GoDaddy they were the worst for hosting (even with a static site). Major issues with them and WP also. When our last client started having issues, i looked it up and saw it was GoDaddy issue only, then i realized MT was bought out by them. So same issues are just carrying over to MT now.
Thanks Everyone. This was good to know!
a nice wpengine alternative is flywheel
